intro: Ischnosiphon koernickeanus, commonly known as the koernickean thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, often spiny stems. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to other regions for horticultural purposes.
